### Random Facts

* Google Scholar says I have an h-index of 15 (this is not necessarily exact value measured using only official publications but is closely correlated with the exact value).
* My Erdős number is 4 (via Jim Demmel).
* My [Erdős-Bacon number](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erd%C5%91s%E2%80%93Bacon_number) is infinity because I have not acted in any movies.  However, my Erdős-[https://www.alcf.anl.gov/staff-directory/charles-bacon (Charles) Bacon] is 5, thanks to Chapter 10  of [this book](http://www.amazon.com/Contemporary-High-Performance-Computing-Computational/dp/1466568348/).

## Projects

### Active

* [https://asc.llnl.gov/CORAL-benchmarks/ CORAL] and [[Blue Gene/Q]] are my primary projects at the moment.

* I am involved in both ASCR Leadership Computing Challenge ([https://www.alcf.anl.gov/alcc-program-0 ALCC]) and [http://www.doeleadershipcomputing.org/ INCITE] projects in computer science and chemistry.

* [https://github.com/jeffhammond/oshmpi OSHMPI] -  OpenSHMEM over MPI-3

* [https://trac.mcs.anl.gov/projects/ospri OSPRI] (follow link for details)

* [http://wiki.mpich.org/armci-mpi/index.php/Main_Page ARMCI-MPI] - Jim Dinan developed a portable, high-performance implementation of ARMCI using MPI-2 RMA with limited help from me.  I am working on the MPI-3 implementation.

* [http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1148485&HistoricalAwards=false NSF SI2-SSI: A Linear Algebra Software Infrastructure for Sustained Innovation in Computational Chemistry and other Sciences] (as part of the [http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~flame/web/team.html FLAME team]).

* [http://gvr.cs.uchicago.edu DOE X-Stack: Global View Resilience (GVR)] (follow link for details)

* [http://ctop.cs.utah.edu/x-tune/ DOE X-Stack: X-Tune] (follow link for details)

* [[NWChem]] - I developed the coupled-cluster response property capability, among other features, during graduate school.  Static partitioning (load-balancing), threading, vectorization and accelerator integrations for NWChem are currently under investigation.

* [[MADNESS]] - [http://iacs.stonybrook.edu/people/faculty/robert-j-harrison Robert Harrison] and I ported MADNESS to Blue Gene/P.  [http://www.alcf.anl.gov/staff-directory/alvaro-vazquez-mayagoitia Alvaro Vazquez-Mayagoitia], [https://www.alcf.anl.gov/staff-directory/nichols-romero Nick Romero], and others are involved in the Blue Gene/Q effort, which includes both performance improvements and new scientific functionality.

### Archives

* [http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ Global Arrays] - I contributed features and tried to maintain the Blue Gene/P port until converting wholly to the use of [http://wiki.mpich.org/armci-mpi/index.php/Main_Page ARMCI-MPI].  Global Arrays is developed at [http://www.pnl.gov/ Pacific Northwest National Laboratory].

* [https://www.alcf.anl.gov/projects/accurate-numerical-simulations-chemical-phenomena-involved-energy-production-and-storage BG/Q ESP] - Robert, Curt, Ed and I have a Blue Gene/Q Early Science Program project entitled ''Accurate Numerical Simulations of Chemical Phenomena Involved in Energy Production and Storage with MADNESS and MPQC.''

* [https://wiki.mcs.anl.gov/unistack/ Unistack] - Unified runtime systems for parallel programming models.

* [[MPQC]] - I helped port and optimize MPQC for Blue Gene/P, with kind support from [http://www.linkedin.com/pub/curtis-janssen/7/454/440 Curt Janssen] and [http://www.files.chem.vt.edu/chem-dept/valeev/ Ed Valeev], who are the lead developers of this code.

* [https://trac.mcs.anl.gov/projects/a1/ A1] (follow link for details)

* [https://code.google.com/p/parallelsampling/ NEUS] ([https://lewis.ci.uchicago.edu/repos/neus NEUS-AC]) - A massively-parallel implementation of non-equilibrium umbrella sampling.  I contribute the computer science portion in a collaboration with the [http://dinner-group.uchicago.edu/ Dinner group] at the [http://www.uchicago.edu University of Chicago].  This project is funded with an [http://www.uchicago.edu/research/news/20102010_argonne.shtml UC-ANL Strategic Collaborative Initiative grant].

* GPU-CC - Eugene DePrince developed a coupled-cluster code for GPUs with help from me.  This code is now part of [http://www.psicode.org/ PSI4].  This project belongs to Eugene now although I'm still making use of lessons learned from it.

* [http://www.cs.uoregon.edu/research/tau TAU]-[http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/parsoft/armci/ ARMCI] - I contributed to the development of TAU profiling capability for the ARMCI communication library.
